info.name: vendor - check order details and history
info.description:
For this test case, we will test the workflow of a vendor checkin the details of a specific order and retrieving all of their orders, and we will also check the order history for a given customer.

First, we create a vendor entity and a customer in the users microservice

Then, we add two distinct dishes

We create a new order for this particular vendor

We retrieve this order

We create a second order for this vendor (same customer id)

We retrieve all orders for the vendor

Finally, we get the customer history for that customer

exec: pm.test("Name is 'Test Restaurant in Range'", function () {

request.description: Creates a new order for the customer with a specified vendor. This is done by selecting a vendor from the list of all vendors basically, so we are sure that the customer is in the range of the vendor.

response.name: Newly created order object with orderId, customerId, vendorId and address populated.
Bad Request - No location present (and no default address for customer) or other input errors (invalid format).
Unauthorized - Not a customer user.
Not Found - User does not exist.
Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred on the server.

request.description: Processes payment for the specified order.

response.name: Payment processed successfully, order status set to accepted.
Bad Request - Payment information missing or payment unsuccessful.
Unauthorized - Order does not belong to user/user is not a customer.
Not Found - Order or user does not exist.
Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred.

item.name: Get order history for a specific customer Copy

request.description: Allows a vendor to view the order history of a specific customer.

response.name: List of orders made by the specified customer for the given vendor
Bad Request - Invalid request parameters.
